content: There exist metaprogramming functions Lean.getStructureInfo? which give the field names. You can even get the projection functions with similar functions. But I can't seem to find an easy way to obtain the type for a field. I understand it can be non-trivial since the structure parameters are required to the in the context, but in my case I only consider structures without parameters.
If you have the projection function, don't you have the type as well?
Inspecting the projection function's type instead of the constructor's can be nicer in the case of dependent structures, but I'm guessing you're not considering those either
Yeah I am taking the type from the projection function, was just wondering if there already exists some function for it that I missed.
Given a general structure with parameters and field dependencies, the projection function's type already is the simplest presentation of the field type
Max Nowak 🐺 has marked this topic as resolved.
